title: BYD Atto 3 facelift revealed
description: A facelifted version of the BYD Atto 3 has been revealed officially. While the interior is yet to break cover, the all-electric BYD SUV gets noticeable exterior updates and improved ADAS functionality. BYD Atto 3 facelift features redesigned bumpers, alloy wheels, tail-lights, and more Enhanced ADAS system uses multiple cameras and 29 sensors Launch details are unconfirmed, but India launch is very likely BYD Atto 3 facelift exterior design The front end of the facelifted Atto 3 gets a larger trapezoidal air dam flanked by slimmer and sportier air intakes. No changes have been made to the headlights and the distinctive chrome-plated panel between them, but the 18-inch alloy wheels feature a new design. Rear end gets more comprehensive updates The D-pillars are now partially blacked-out too, and it gets a new roof spoiler with dual brake lights and a redesigned rear bumper. The tail-lamps also get new interweaving LED signatures with dynamic turn signals. BYD Atto 3 facelift ADAS features One of the headline inclusions of the Atto 3 facelift is the "God's Eye C" ADAS system, which uses a three-camera block mounted underneath the windshield, four surround-view cameras, five long-range cameras, five mm-wave radars, 12 ultrasonic radars and 29 sensors all around the SUV. BYD claims that the facelifted Atto 3 supports 10 high-speed navigation scenarios and six intelligent parking modes. BYD Atto 3 facelift battery and range Mechanically, the Atto 3 facelift will most likely remain unchanged. The India-spec Atto 3 is powered by a 60.5kWh LFP battery pushing 204hp and 310Nm of torque through a single front-mounted motor. There's also a 49.9kWh version of the Atto 3 that generates the same amount of power, but has a lower 345km WLTP range compared to the 60.5kWh version's 420km WLTP range. BYD Atto 3 facelift launch details The company has yet to confirm its exact launch plans for the Atto 3 facelift. Since BYD has been attempting to grow its presence in India, the facelifted Atto 3 will most likely make it here as well. html:
BYD Atto 3 facelift gets sportier styling compared to the outgoing model, as well as more advanced ADAS features.

A facelifted version of the BYD Atto 3 has been revealed officially. While the interior is yet to break cover, the all-electric BYD SUV gets noticeable exterior updates and improved ADAS functionality.

  1. BYD Atto 3 facelift features redesigned bumpers, alloy wheels, tail-lights, and more
  2. Enhanced ADAS system uses multiple cameras and 29 sensors
  3. Launch details are unconfirmed, but India launch is very likely

BYD Atto 3 facelift exterior design

The front end of the facelifted Atto 3 gets a larger trapezoidal air dam flanked by slimmer and sportier air intakes. No changes have been made to the headlights and the distinctive chrome-plated panel between them, but the 18-inch alloy wheels feature a new design.

Rear end gets more comprehensive updates

The D-pillars are now partially blacked-out too, and it gets a new roof spoiler with dual brake lights and a redesigned rear bumper. The tail-lamps also get new interweaving LED signatures with dynamic turn signals.

BYD Atto 3 facelift ADAS features

One of the headline inclusions of the Atto 3 facelift is the "God's Eye C" ADAS system, which uses a three-camera block mounted underneath the windshield, four surround-view cameras, five long-range cameras, five mm-wave radars, 12 ultrasonic radars and 29 sensors all around the SUV. BYD claims that the facelifted Atto 3 supports 10 high-speed navigation scenarios and six intelligent parking modes.

BYD Atto 3 facelift battery and range

Mechanically, the Atto 3 facelift will most likely remain unchanged. The India-spec Atto 3 is powered by a 60.5kWh LFP battery pushing 204hp and 310Nm of torque through a single front-mounted motor. There's also a 49.9kWh version of the Atto 3 that generates the same amount of power, but has a lower 345km WLTP range compared to the 60.5kWh version's 420km WLTP range.

BYD Atto 3 facelift launch details

The company has yet to confirm its exact launch plans for the Atto 3 facelift. Since BYD has been attempting to grow its presence in India, the facelifted Atto 3 will most likely make it here as well.
